comments.html:
Hi,

This is being pushed by all Vendors.

http://www.cisco.com/en/US/prod/collateral/routers/ps5763/prod_white_paper0900aecd80395e03.html

http://www.juniper.net/us/en/local/pdf/whitepapers/2000283-en.pdf

Mgmt is G709. Which in time (I guess) will be replaced by GMPLS. It's not mature yet but I'm sold.

its all Ethernet from the router side..

a) LANPHY IPoETHo(ProboDWDM)
b) WANPHY IPoEthoSDH(ProboDWDM)
c) WDMPHY IPoDWDM

It DOES look good and looks to me to be going in the right direction.. Just needs to mature as a IP Backbone technology.
comments.name: Bad Designer

comments.html:
ALU has been doing many things right in the past few years. It largely goes unnoticed, because ALU has *really* bad reputation with smaller ISPs and Telcos from the old days of Telephony world (in short, they would "talk" to incumbent only). They have been trying to get away with that and with some really great products. For example, their ESS switches are masterpiece that solves so many problems people using Cisco are facing every day.

This new launch is probably continuation of that policy and thinking. It remains to be seen how it does on the marked, dominated by C&J.
comments.name: Marko Milivojevic

comments.html:
Sounds strangely familiar to the Newbridge IP-over ATM Convergence campaign (of which I was a part) in the late90's. Lets see.. lets move IP directly to ATM (over fiber) Converge Video, Image, Voice & Data on one medium and one transport.
Great Idea then, never quite made it.

Good luck Newbridge-Alcatel-Lucent ;)
comments.name: Former- Newbridge-Alcatel Worker
